s1.name: Hot topics
s1.subtitle: Administration refactoring
s1.p: A wide interest has been shown in the refactoring of JORAM's administration. This topic includes:

ul.li: The refactoring of the administration interface as well as of the internal communication protocol.
The development of a graphical tool for allowing easier and friendlier admin work.
Supporting JMX for allowing an easier administration of JORAM inside JOnAS.

s1.subtitle: kJoram: a light Joram for portable devices
s1.p: The aim of this work is to provide to client applications running on portable devices a gate for accessing Joram messaging functionnalities. This work includes:

ul.li: The development of an HTTP/SOAP proxy in Joram's server for allowing external communications based on HTTP and XML.
The development of a JMS-like client interface for applications running on J2ME.

s2.name: Documentation
s2.p: A PDF document gives some information on this topic.

s2.name: Contributions
s2.p: Contributors already started to work. Many thanks to all of them.

ul.li: Fernando Rocha and Jose Carlos Waeny developed a GUI prototype based on the current admin interface: try it !
Jeff Mesnil provided us with an insight of what administration looks like when based on JMX: try it !
A first sketch of the administration interface is also available there .

s2.name: Feeding back, or getting involved
s2.p: The contact person for this topic is Frederic Maistre .

s1.name: kJoram
s1.p: All the work on this topic has been done by Alexandre Gimard and Sylvain Treboz at INRIA in Grenoble. They managed to develop the proxy server side and the client interface and successfuly tested it.
Their work is still based on Joram's and JMS' old versions, and will be adapted to the latest releases.
